conclusion: Analyze forces to determine the ratio of rope tension to force on child.
Gravitational force on pillow is F_{g1} = m_1 g.
Gravitational force on child is F_{g2} = m_2 g.
Tension in the rope is T.
Forces along and perpendicular to slope must balance in equilibrium.
Component of gravitational force on pillow along slope is F_{g1} sin(α).
Component of gravitational force on child along slope is F_{g2} sin(α).
Component of gravitational force on pillow perpendicular to slope is F_{g1} cos(α).
Component of gravitational force on child perpendicular to slope is F_{g2} cos(α).
Tension in rope has components: T cos(β) along slope, T sin(β) perpendicular.
Force exerted by pillow on child is T sin(β).
Set up equilibrium equation along slope: T cos(β) = (m_1 + m_2) g sin(α).
Set up equilibrium equation perpendicular to slope: T sin(β) = (m_1 + m_2) g cos(α).
Find ratio of tension to force on child: T / T sin(β) = 1 / sin(β).
Solve for tension T: T = (m_1 + m_2) g cos(α) / sin(β).
